intro: Coccoloba tenuis, commonly known as the narrowleaf coral tree, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with small, elliptical leaflets and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and along riverbanks. Coccoloba tenuis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and floral display.
